alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:20PM EST until January 11 at 4:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Conodoguinet Creek near Hogestown affecting Cumberland County. .Recent rainfall and snowmelt will contribute to rising river levels along Swatara Creek through Thursday. Additional rainfall Friday into Saturday will result in additional rises through the weekend. For the Conodoguinet Creek...including Hogestown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Conodoguinet Creek near Hogestown. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Low lying areas in the vicinity of Erbs Bridge Road, Prowell Road, Stone Spring Lane, and Oyster Mill Road are flooded. At 10.0 feet, Some residences in the vicinity of Erb`s Bridge Road, Prowell Road, Stone Spring Lane, and Oyster Mill Road are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:32 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:32 PM EST Wednesday was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.7 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. The river will fall below action stage Friday before rising again into the weekend. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.9 feet on 05/08/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning.
